summary: This is an official letter from the Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, notifying two federal judges of the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. It states Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell on the morning of August 10, 2019, after an apparent suicide, and was later pronounced dead at a hospital. The FBI and DOJ Inspector General are investigating the incident.

connections.description: Martin Weinberg is listed as counsel for Jeffrey Epstein in the court case.
Reid Weingarten is listed as counsel for Jeffrey Epstein in the court case.
Both are federal judges presiding over the United States v. Jeffrey Epstein case, jointly addressed in the official notification.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York at approximately 6:30 a.m. He was transported to a hospital and pronounced dead at 7:37 a.m. The incident is described as an apparent suicide and is under investigation by the FBI and DOJ Inspector General.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
New York Presbyterian-Lower Manhattan Hospital, New York, New York
Daniel Patrick Moynihan United States Courthouse, New York, New York 10007-1312
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died on the morning of August 10, 2019, while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
He was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at approximately 6:30 a.m. and pronounced dead at a hospital at 7:37 a.m.
The incident is officially described as an 'apparent suicide' and is under active investigation by the FBI and the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General.
The official cause of death was pending an autopsy at the time of the notification.
The letter was sent to the presiding judges in his federal case, Judges Colleen McMahon and Richard M. Berman.
